detaileddescription.para: Returns a list of all commands supported by the wallet API.
This lists each command, along with its arguments and return types. For more detailed help on a single command, use get_help()

simplesect.para: a multi-line string suitable for displaying on a terminal

detaileddescription.para: Returns info about the current state of the blockchain

Returns info such as client version, git version of graphene/fc, version of boost, openssl.
compile time info and client and dependencies versions
Returns the information about a block

parameterdescription.para: Block num

simplesect.para: Public block data on the blockchain

detaileddescription.para: Returns sequence of operations included/generated in a specified block

parameterdescription.para: Block height of specified block
Whether to only return virtual operations

detaileddescription.para: Return the current price feed history

simplesect.para: Price feed history data on the blockchain

detaileddescription.para: Returns the list of witnesses producing blocks in the current round (21 Blocks)
Returns the queue of pow miners waiting to produce blocks.
Returns the state info associated with the URL
Returns vesting withdraw routes for an account.

parameterdescription.para: Account to query routes
Withdraw type type [incoming, outgoing, all]

detaileddescription.para: Gets the account information for all accounts for which this wallet has a private key
Lists all accounts registered in the blockchain. This returns a list of all account names and their account ids, sorted by account name.

Use the lowerbound and limit parameters to page through the list. To retrieve all accounts, start by setting lowerbound to the empty string "", and then each iteration, pass the last account name returned as the lowerbound for the next list_accounts() call.

parameterdescription.para: the name of the first account to return. If the named account does not exist, the list will start at the account that comes after lowerbound
the maximum number of accounts to return (max: 1000)

simplesect.para: a list of accounts mapping account names to account ids

detaileddescription.para:
Returns the block chain's rapidly-changing properties. The returned object contains information that changes every block interval such as the head block number, the next witness, etc.
get_global_properties() for less-frequently changing properties
the dynamic global properties
Returns information about the given account.

parameterdescription.para: the name of the account to provide information about

simplesect.para: the public account data stored in the blockchain

detaileddescription.para: Returns the current wallet filename.
This is the filename that will be used when automatically saving the wallet.
Get the WIF private key corresponding to a public key. The private key must already be in the wallet.

memberdef.argsstring: (string account, string role, string password) const
memberdef.name: get_private_key_from_password

parameterdescription.para: - active | owner | posting | memo

detaileddescription.para: Returns transaction by ID.
Checks whether the wallet has just been created and has not yet had a password set.

Calling set_password will transition the wallet to the locked state.
true if the wallet is new
Checks whether the wallet is locked (is unable to use its private keys).

This state can be changed by calling lock() or unlock().
true if the wallet is locked
Locks the wallet immediately.
Unlocks the wallet.

The wallet remain unlocked until the lock is called or the program exits.
password
the password previously set with set_password()
Sets a new password on the wallet.
The wallet must be either 'new' or 'unlocked' to execute this command.
Dumps all private keys owned by the wallet.

The keys are printed in WIF format. You can import these keys into another wallet using import_key()
a map containing the private keys, indexed by their public key

Returns detailed help on a single API command.
method
the name of the API command you want help with
a multi-line string suitable for displaying on a terminal
Loads a specified Graphene wallet.
The current wallet is closed before the new wallet is loaded.

simplesect.para: This does not change the filename that will be used for future wallet writes, so this may cause you to overwrite your original wallet unless you also call set_wallet_filename()

parameterdescription.para: the filename of the wallet JSON file to load. If wallet_filename is empty, it reloads the existing wallet file

simplesect.para: true if the specified wallet is loaded

detaileddescription.para: Saves the current wallet to the given filename.

simplesect.para: This does not change the wallet filename that will be used for future writes, so think of this function as 'Save a Copy As...' instead of 'Save As...'. Use set_wallet_filename() to make the filename persist.

parameterdescription.para: the filename of the new wallet JSON file to create or overwrite. If wallet_filename is empty, save to the current filename.

detaileddescription.para: Sets the wallet filename used for future writes.
This does not trigger a save, it only changes the default filename that will be used the next time a save is triggered.

parameterdescription.para: the new filename to use for future saves

detaileddescription.para:
Suggests a safe brain key to use for creating your account. create_account_with_brain_key() requires you to specify a 'brain key', a long passphrase that provides enough entropy to generate cyrptographic keys. This function will suggest a suitably random string that should be easy to write down (and, with effort, memorize).
a suggested brain_key
Converts a signed_transaction in JSON form to its binary representation.
TODO: I don't see a broadcast_transaction() function, do we need one?

parameterdescription.para: the transaction to serialize

simplesect.para: the binary form of the transaction. It will not be hex encoded, this returns a raw string that may have null characters embedded in it

detaileddescription.para: Imports a WIF Private Key into the wallet to be used to sign transactions by an account.
example: import_key 5KQwrPbwdL6PhXujxW37FSSQZ1JiwsST4cqQzDeyXtP79zkvFD3

parameterdescription.para: the WIF Private Key to import

detaileddescription.para: Transforms a brain key to reduce the chance of errors when re-entering the key from memory.

This takes a user-supplied brain key and normalizes it into the form used for generating private keys. In particular, this upper-cases all ASCII characters and collapses multiple spaces into one.
s
the brain key as supplied by the user
the brain key in its normalized form

memberdef.argsstring: (string creator, string new_account_name, string json_meta, bool broadcast)
memberdef.name: create_account

detaileddescription.para: This method will genrate new owner, active, and memo keys for the new account which will be controlable by this wallet. There is a fee associated with account creation that is paid by the creator. The current account creation fee can be found with the 'info' wallet command.

creator
The account creating the new account
new_account_name
The name of the new account
json_meta
JSON Metadata associated with the new account
broadcast
true if you wish to broadcast the transaction
This method will genrate new owner, active, and memo keys for the new account which will be controlable by this wallet.

memberdef.argsstring: (string creator, string newname, string json_meta, public_key_type owner, public_key_type active, public_key_type posting, public_key_type memo, bool broadcast) const
memberdef.name: create_account_with_keys

detaileddescription.para: This method is used by faucets to create new accounts for other users which must provide their desired keys. The resulting account may not be controllable by this wallet. There is a fee associated with account creation that is paid by the creator. The current account creation fee can be found with the 'info' wallet command.

creator
The account creating the new account
newname
The name of the new account
json_meta
JSON Metadata associated with the new account
owner
public owner key of the new account
active
public active key of the new account
posting
public posting key of the new account
memo
public memo key of the new account
broadcast
true if you wish to broadcast the transaction
This method is used by faucets to create new accounts for other users which must provide their desired keys. The resulting account may not be controllable by this wallet.

memberdef.argsstring: (string accountname, string json_meta, public_key_type owner, public_key_type active, public_key_type posting, public_key_type memo, bool broadcast) const
memberdef.name: update_account

detaileddescription.para: This method updates the keys of an existing account.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the account
New JSON Metadata to be associated with the account
New public owner key for the account
New public active key for the account
New public posting key for the account
New public memo key for the account
true if you wish to broadcast the transaction

memberdef.argsstring: (string account_name, authority_type type, public_key_type key, weight_type weight, bool broadcast)
memberdef.name: update_account_auth_key

detaileddescription.para: This method updates the key of an authority for an exisiting account. Warning: You can create impossible authorities using this method. The method will fail if you create an impossible owner authority, but will allow impossible active and posting authorities.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the account whose authority you wish to update
The authority type. e.g. owner, active, or posting
The public key to add to the authority
The weight the key should have in the authority. A weight of 0 indicates the removal of the key.
true if you wish to broadcast the transaction.

memberdef.argsstring: (string account_name, authority_type type, string auth_account, weight_type weight, bool broadcast)
memberdef.name: update_account_auth_account

detaileddescription.para: This method updates the account of an authority for an exisiting account. Warning: You can create impossible authorities using this method. The method will fail if you create an impossible owner authority, but will allow impossible active and posting authorities.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the account whose authority you wish to update
The authority type. e.g. owner, active, or posting
The account to add the the authority
The weight the account should have in the authority. A weight of 0 indicates the removal of the account.
true if you wish to broadcast the transaction.

memberdef.argsstring: (string account_name, authority_type type, uint32_t threshold, bool broadcast)
memberdef.name: update_account_auth_threshold

detaileddescription.para: This method updates the weight threshold of an authority for an account. Warning: You can create impossible authorities using this method as well as implicitly met authorities. The method will fail if you create an implicitly true authority and if you create an impossible owner authoroty, but will allow impossible active and posting authorities.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the account whose authority you wish to update
The authority type. e.g. owner, active, or posting
The weight threshold required for the authority to be met
true if you wish to broadcast the transaction

detaileddescription.para: This method updates the account JSON metadata

parameterdescription.para: The name of the account you wish to update
The new JSON metadata for the account. This overrides existing metadata
ture if you wish to broadcast the transaction

detaileddescription.para: This method updates the memo key of an account

parameterdescription.para: The name of the account you wish to update
The new memo public key
true if you wish to broadcast the transaction

detaileddescription.para: This method is used to convert a JSON transaction to its transaction ID.

Lists all witnesses registered in the blockchain. This returns a list of all account names that own witnesses, and the associated witness id, sorted by name. This lists witnesses whether they are currently voted in or not.

Use the lowerbound and limit parameters to page through the list. To retrieve all witnesss, start by setting lowerbound to the empty string "", and then each iteration, pass the last witness name returned as the lowerbound for the next list_witnesss() call.

parameterdescription.para: the name of the first witness to return. If the named witness does not exist, the list will start at the witness that comes after lowerbound
the maximum number of witnesss to return (max: 1000)

simplesect.para: a list of witnesss mapping witness names to witness ids

detaileddescription.para:
Returns information about the given witness.
owner_account
the name or id of the witness account owner, or the id of the witness
the information about the witness stored in the block chain
Returns conversion requests by an account

parameterdescription.para: Account name of the account owning the requests

simplesect.para: All pending conversion requests by account

memberdef.argsstring: (string witness_name, string url, public_key_type block_signing_key, const chain_properties &props, bool broadcast=false)
memberdef.name: update_witness

detaileddescription.para: Update a witness object owned by the given account.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the witness account.
A URL containing some information about the witness. The empty string makes it remain the same.
The new block signing public key. The empty string disables block production.
The chain properties the witness is voting on.
true if you wish to broadcast the transaction.

detaileddescription.para: Set the voting proxy for an account.
If a user does not wish to take an active part in voting, they can choose to allow another account to vote their stake.
Setting a vote proxy does not remove your previous votes from the blockchain, they remain there but are ignored. If you later null out your vote proxy, your previous votes will take effect again.
This setting can be changed at any time.

parameterdescription.para: the name or id of the account to update
the name of account that should proxy to, or empty string to have no proxy
true if you wish to broadcast the transaction

memberdef.argsstring: (string account_to_vote_with, string witness_to_vote_for, bool approve=true, bool broadcast=false)
memberdef.name: vote_for_witness

detaileddescription.para: Vote for a witness to become a block producer. By default an account has not voted positively or negatively for a witness. The account can either vote for with positively votes or against with negative votes. The vote will remain until updated with another vote. Vote strength is determined by the accounts vesting shares.

parameterdescription.para: The account voting for a witness
The witness that is being voted for
true if the account is voting for the account to be able to be a block produce
true if you wish to broadcast the transaction

memberdef.argsstring: (string from, string to, asset amount, string memo, bool broadcast=false)
memberdef.name: transfer

detaileddescription.para: Transfer funds from one account to another. STEEM and SBD can be transferred.

parameterdescription.para: The account the funds are coming from
The account the funds are going to
The funds being transferred. i.e. "100.000 STEEM"
A memo for the transactionm, encrypted with the to account's public memo key
true if you wish to broadcast the transaction

detaileddescription.para: Transfer funds from one account to another using escrow. STEEM and SBD can be transferred.

The account the funds are going to
The account acting as the agent in case of dispute
A unique id for the escrow transfer. (from, escrow_id) must be a unique pair
The amount of SBD to transfer
The amount of STEEM to transfer
The fee paid to the agent
The deadline for 'to' and 'agent' to approve the escrow transfer
The expiration of the escrow transfer, after which either party can claim the funds
JSON encoded meta data
true if you wish to broadcast the transaction

parameterdescription.para: The account that funded the escrow
The destination of the escrow
The account acting as the agent in case of dispute
The account approving the escrow transfer (either 'to' or 'agent)
A unique id for the escrow transfer
true to approve the escrow transfer, otherwise cancels it and refunds 'from'
true if you wish to broadcast the transaction

The destination of the escrow
The account acting as the agent in case of dispute
The account raising the dispute (either 'from' or 'to')
A unique id for the escrow transfer
true if you wish to broadcast the transaction

memberdef.name: escrow_release

detaileddescription.para: Release funds help in escrow

parameterdescription.para: The account that funded the escrow
The account the funds are originally going to
The account acting as the agent in case of dispute
The account authorizing the release
The account that will receive funds being released
A unique id for the escrow transfer
The amount of SBD that will be released
The amount of STEEM that will be released
true if you wish to broadcast the transaction

memberdef.argsstring: (string from, string to, asset amount, bool broadcast=false)
memberdef.name: transfer_to_vesting

detaileddescription.para: Transfer STEEM into a vesting fund represented by vesting shares (VESTS). VESTS are required to vesting for a minimum of one coin year and can be withdrawn once a week over a two year withdraw period. VESTS are protected against dilution up until 90% of STEEM is vesting.

parameterdescription.para: The account the STEEM is coming from
The account getting the VESTS
The amount of STEEM to vest i.e. "100.00 STEEM"
true if you wish to broadcast the transaction

memberdef.argsstring: (string from, string to, asset amount, string memo, bool broadcast=false)
memberdef.name: transfer_to_savings

detaileddescription.para: Transfers into savings happen immediately, transfers from savings take 72 hours

memberdef.argsstring: (string from, uint32_t request_id, string to, asset amount, string memo, bool broadcast=false)
memberdef.name: transfer_from_savings

parameterdescription.para: - an unique ID assigned by from account, the id is used to cancel the operation and can be reused after the transfer completes
the id used in transfer_from_savings
the account that initiated the transfer

detaileddescription.para: Set up a vesting withdraw request. The request is fulfilled once a week over the next two year (104 weeks).

parameterdescription.para: The account the VESTS are withdrawn from
The amount of VESTS to withdraw over the next two years. Each week (amount/104) shares are withdrawn and deposited back as STEEM. i.e. "10.000000 VESTS"
true if you wish to broadcast the transaction

memberdef.argsstring: (string from, string to, uint16_t percent, bool auto_vest, bool broadcast=false)
memberdef.name: set_withdraw_vesting_route

detaileddescription.para: Set up a vesting withdraw route. When vesting shares are withdrawn, they will be routed to these accounts based on the specified weights.

parameterdescription.para: The account the VESTS are withdrawn from.
The account receiving either VESTS or STEEM.
The percent of the withdraw to go to the 'to' account. This is denoted in hundreths of a percent. i.e. 100 is 1% and 10000 is 100%. This value must be between 1 and 100000
Set to true if the from account should receive the VESTS as VESTS, or false if it should receive them as STEEM.
true if you wish to broadcast the transaction.

detaileddescription.para: This method will convert SBD to STEEM at the current_median_history price one week from the time it is executed. This method depends upon there being a valid price feed.

parameterdescription.para: The account requesting conversion of its SBD i.e. "1.000 SBD"
The amount of SBD to convert
true if you wish to broadcast the transaction

detaileddescription.para: A witness can public a price feed for the STEEM:SBD market. The median price feed is used to process conversion requests from SBD to STEEM.

parameterdescription.para: The witness publishing the price feed
The desired exchange rate
true if you wish to broadcast the transaction

detaileddescription.para: Signs a transaction.

Given a fully-formed transaction that is only lacking signatures, this signs the transaction with the necessary keys and optionally broadcasts the transaction
tx
the unsigned transaction
broadcast
true if you wish to broadcast the transaction
the signed version of the transaction
Returns an uninitialized object representing a given blockchain operation.

This returns a default-initialized object of the given type; it can be used during early development of the wallet when we don't yet have custom commands for creating all of the operations the blockchain supports.

Any operation the blockchain supports can be created using the transaction builder's add_operation_to_builder_transaction() , but to do that from the CLI you need to know what the JSON form of the operation looks like. This will give you a template you can fill in. It's better than nothing.

parameterdescription.para: the type of operation to return, must be one of the operations defined in steemit/chain/operations.hpp (e.g., "global_parameters_update_operation")

simplesect.para: a default-constructed operation of the given type

detaileddescription.para: Gets the current order book for STEEM:SBD

parameterdescription.para: Maximum number of orders to return for bids and asks. Max is 1000.

memberdef.name: create_order

detaileddescription.para: Creates a limit order at the price amount_to_sell / min_to_receive and will deduct amount_to_sell from account

parameterdescription.para: The name of the account creating the order
is a unique identifier assigned by the creator of the order, it can be reused after the order has been filled
The amount of either SBD or STEEM you wish to sell
The amount of the other asset you will receive at a minimum
true if you want the order to be killed if it cannot immediately be filled
the time the order should expire if it has not been filled
true if you wish to broadcast the transaction

detaileddescription.para: Cancel an order created with create_order

parameterdescription.para: The name of the account owning the order to cancel_order
The unique identifier assigned to the order by its creator
true if you wish to broadcast the transaction

detaileddescription.para: Sets the amount of time in the future until a transaction expires.
Challenge a user's authority. The challenger pays a fee to the challenged which is depositted as Golos Power. Until the challenged proves their active key, all posting rights are revoked.

parameterdescription.para: The account issuing the challenge
The account being challenged
true if you wish to broadcast the transaction

memberdef.argsstring: (string recovery_account, string account_to_recover, authority new_authority, bool broadcast)
memberdef.name: request_account_recovery

detaileddescription.para: Create an account recovery request as a recover account. The syntax for this command contains a serialized authority object so there is an example below on how to pass in the authority.
request_account_recovery "your_account" "account_to_recover" {"weight_threshold": 1,"account_auths": [], "key_auths": [["new_public_key",1]]} true

parameterdescription.para: The name of your account
The name of the account you are trying to recover
The new owner authority for the recovered account. This should be given to you by the holder of the compromised or lost account.
true if you wish to broadcast the transaction

memberdef.argsstring: (string account_to_recover, authority recent_authority, authority new_authority, bool broadcast)
memberdef.name: recover_account

detaileddescription.para: Recover your account using a recovery request created by your recovery account. The syntax for this commain contains a serialized authority object, so there is an example below on how to pass in the authority.
recover_account "your_account" {"weight_threshold": 1,"account_auths": [], "key_auths": [["old_public_key",1]]} {"weight_threshold": 1,"account_auths": [], "key_auths": [["new_public_key",1]]} true

parameterdescription.para: The name of your account
A recent owner authority on your account
The new authority that your recovery account used in the account recover request.
true if you wish to broadcast the transaction

detaileddescription.para: Change your recovery account after a 30 day delay.

parameterdescription.para: The name of your account
The name of the recovery account you wish to have
true if you wish to broadcast the transaction

detaileddescription.para: Prove an account's active authority, fulfilling a challenge, restoring posting rights, and making the account immune to challenge for 24 hours.

parameterdescription.para: The account that was challenged and is proving its authority.
true if you wish to broadcast the transaction

detaileddescription.para: Account operations have sequence numbers from 0 to N where N is the most recent operation. This method returns operations in the range [from-limit, from]

parameterdescription.para: - account whose history will be returned
- the absolute sequence number, -1 means most recent, limit is the number of operations before from.
- the maximum number of items that can be queried (0 to 1000], must be less than from

detaileddescription.para: Returns the encrypted memo if memo starts with '#' otherwise returns memo
Returns the decrypted memo if possible given wallet's known private keys

This wallet assumes it is connected to the database server with a high-bandwidth, low-latency connection and performs minimal caching. This API could be provided locally to be used by a web interface.
